title: _bar.py does not open a new figure
body:
Running this [example code](https://shap.readthedocs.io/en/latest/example_notebooks/overviews/Be%20careful%20when%20interpreting%20predictive%20models%20in%20search%20of%20causal%C2%A0insights.html), in particular by running these two commands successively:
```
shap.plots.scatter(shap_values, ylabel="SHAP value\n(higher means more likely to renew)", overlay={
    "True causal effects": marginal_effects(generator, 10000, X.columns)
})
```
```
# Economy is independent of other measured features.
shap.plots.bar(shap_values, clustering=clust, clustering_cutoff=1)
```
I noted the plots.bar does not open a new figure, but rather does (line 210):
```
    fig = pl.gcf()
    ax = pl.gca()
```
so that the bar plot is plotted on the scatter figure.


I do not understand the library well enough to say if this is intended or not, but I notice that other plot scripts open a new figure by default, e.g. _scatter.py line 87
`f = pl.subplots(1, len(inds), figsize=(min(6 * len(inds), 15), 5))`

Maybe needs a fix?
